```{r}
library(rjags)

# Data 
N <- 30
Ti <- 5
xb <- 22
x <- c(8.0, 15.0, 22.0, 29.0, 36.0)
Y <- matrix(c(151, 199, 246, 283, 320,
                 145, 199, 249, 293, 354,
                 147, 214, 263, 312, 328,
                 155, 200, 237, 272, 297,
                 135, 188, 230, 280, 323,
                 159, 210, 252, 298, 331,
                 141, 189, 231, 275, 305,
                 159, 201, 248, 297, 338,
                 177, 236, 285, 350, 376,
                 134, 182, 220, 260, 296,
                 160, 208, 261, 313, 352,
                 143, 188, 220, 273, 314,
                 154, 200, 244, 289, 325,
                 171, 221, 270, 326, 358,
                 163, 216, 242, 281, 312,
                 160, 207, 248, 288, 324,
                 142, 187, 234, 280, 316,
                 156, 203, 243, 283, 317,
                 157, 212, 259, 307, 336,
                 152, 203, 246, 286, 321,
                 154, 205, 253, 298, 334,
                 139, 190, 225, 267, 302,
                 146, 191, 229, 272, 302,
                 157, 211, 250, 285, 323,
                 132, 185, 237, 286, 331,
                 160, 207, 257, 303, 345,
                 169, 216, 261, 295, 333,
                 157, 205, 248, 289, 316,
                 137, 180, 219, 258, 291,
                 153, 200, 244, 286, 324), nrow=N, ncol= Ti, byrow=TRUE)

mean <- c(0, 0)
var_prior <- diag(c(1e6, 1e6))
Omega <- matrix(c(200.0, 0, 0, 0.2), nrow=2, byrow=TRUE)

# Initialisation
inits <- function() {
list(alpha = c(250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250,
                  250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250, 250),
      beta = c(6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6,
                  6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6, 6),         
      alpha.c = 150, mu_beta2 = 10,
      tau.c = 1, alpha.tau = 1, tauC = 1)}

# Model
model_string <- "
   model
   {
      for( i in 1 : N ) {
         for( j in 1 : Ti ) {
            Y[i , j] ~ dnorm(mu[i , j],tau.c)
            mu[i , j] <- alpha[i] + beta[i] * (x[j] - xb)
         }
         alpha[i] ~ dnorm(alpha.c,alpha.tau)
         beta[i] ~ dnorm(mu_beta2,tauC)
      }
      tau.c ~ dgamma(0.001,0.001)
      sigma <- 1 / sqrt(tau.c)
      alpha.c ~ dnorm(0.0,1.0E-6)   
      alpha.tau ~ dgamma(0.001,0.001)
      mu_beta2 ~ dnorm(0.0,1.0E-6)
      tauC ~ dgamma(0.001,0.001)
      mu_beta1 <- alpha.c - xb * mu_beta2   
   }"

# Data list 
data_jags <- list(Y = Y, N = N, Ti = Ti, x = x, xb= xb, mean = mean, var_prior = var_prior, Omega = Omega)


# Parametres à estimer
params <- c("mu_beta1", "mu_beta2","sigma")



# MCMC parametrage
n_iter <- 10000
n_burn <- 2500
n_thin <- 2
n_chains <- 2

model <- jags.model(textConnection(model_string), data = data_jags, inits = inits, n.chains = n_chains)
update(model, n_burn)
samples <- coda.samples(model, variable.names = params, n.iter = n_iter / n_thin)

# Convergence
library(coda)
gelman.diag(samples)
autocorr.diag(samples)
effectiveSize(samples)

summary(samples)

print(gelman.diag(samples))
print(autocorr.diag(samples))
print(effectiveSize(samples))

# Plotting trace plots
traceplot(samples)


summary(samples)

```

# Trace plot pour sigma
plot(samples[, "sigma"], main = "Trace Plot pour sigma")
